Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 61.
_description: History of the World from Adam to 1518, in centuries, with numerous digressions and prayers to O.T. heroes, Christian saints, and an introductory prose prologue — generally in interlocking cross-rhymed quatrains

BodeMus160.First Lines:
ADame prince of all mankindffirst indwellerre of paradiseGod
                    gaue the lordshipe ose we findeOf erthly creaturs in euery
                    wise…
BodeMus160.Last Lines:
…And bringe vs all vnto thy blysse& namly kep all tru
                    CristinteeAll heretikes thes sectes & haithen wisseThat
                    of all on flok & fold may bee
BodeMus160.Note:
With a prose prologue preceding on f. 1, beginning, ‘THe gret
                    gloriuse saynte & holy doctore Saint Ierome In the secund part of his
                    Explanaciouns writes a lityll buke off the dignytes & nobyll dedes of sum of
                    þe most nobill & holyeste faders Of the old testament…’ (f.
                    1); prose lists of saints in each century after Christ between stanzas on
                    same.
BodeMus160.Attributed Title:
This endit the viiith day afor Cristmeme (sic) [ ]
                    ȝer of our lord Ihesu M D & xviii wher the [ ] matere failes I besekthe
                    rede to amend [ ] & haue pite one my lewt raclenes & pray f[ ] (by
                    scribe, rubric, f. 108)
